thread.title: Toronto Blue Jays take the early lead over the Kansas City Royals in ALCS Game 5
thread.title_full: Toronto Blue Jays take the early lead over the Kansas City Royals in ALCS Game 5 - The Globe and Mail

author: Globe staff
title: Toronto Blue Jays take the early lead over the Kansas City Royals in ALCS Game 5
text:
A A After a 14-2 thumping in Game 4, the Toronto Blue Jays are looking to stave off elimination with a win on Wednesday at the Rogers Centre. The Kansas City Royals lead the series 3-1.
Today's score: 1-0 Toronto
Tweets from https://twitter.com/arikligeti/lists/jays-globe
What you need to know:
– It’s a rematch of Game 1’s starters, with Marco Estrada getting the start for the Blue Jays against the Royals’ Edinson Volquez.
– Estrada threw 5 1/3 innings in Game 1, giving up three runs in the process. Volquez threw 6 innings and didn’t surrender a single run.
– In 1985, the Royals came back from a 3-1 series deficit to beat the Blue Jays in the ALCS and advance to the World Series. Can the Blue Jays return the favour 30 years later?
– Lefty Jays reliever Aaron Loup is unavailable again today for personal reasons. Starter (and left-hander) David Price will be available out of the bullpen.
– We have Blue Jays Bingo . You should play it while you watch.
Follow us on Twitter: @Globe_Sports
